title: Why do elements in the periodic table have different colours? - Quora

response.answer_text: Various people color the elements that have common chemical behaviors so that it is easy to see that helium, neon, argon, xenon, radon and oganessen are all chemically noble gasses and inert to most chemical reactions. The colors form a pattern on the table and hints at the chemical significance of a position on the table.
The periodic table is often colour coded to make finding different groups of elements easier. Alkali metals,Alkaline earth metals,Halogens,Noble gasses,Metals,Nonmetals,Metalloids.
